page.title: 20BRUNSWICK SCHOOL, HULL
page.content: Brunswick is a Junior High School close to the city centre. It is a Group 5 school with about 300 children on roll, in what is designated a Social Priority Area. The school buildings are about 100 years old and during their history were once used for the local College of Commerce. The school has a wide and varied curriculum and maintains strong links with the community. This block was surveyed with the co-operation of three schools. The compilers were John Swales, Mike Waterhouse, Sylvia Nicholson, Val Gibson (Clifton), Colin Middleton (Stepney), Pam Rose, Arline Cundill (Brunswick) and many pupils, parents and staff who all played their part.
